name: GenAI Engineer (Robotics Homecoming)
summary: Tailored for Senserbot. Explains the pivot away from robotics due to the past market landscape and frames the application as an exciting return to the user's academic roots.
content: Dear {{dear who}} at {{dear at where}},

I am writing to apply for the **Generative AI Engineer** role. This application represents a significant personal milestone for me: a chance to combine my professional expertise in software engineering with my academic roots in robotics.

When I graduated with my degree in **Electronics Engineering (Robotics & Automation)** in 2021, the robotics landscape in Malaysia was relatively quiet. To build a sustainable career, I pivoted to Software Engineering, focusing on building robust, scalable web applications. However, seeing the industry enter a new age with pioneers like Senserbot, I am thrilled by the possibility of 'coming back' to the field I originally fell in love with.
I believe my unique blend of high-level software discipline and low-level engineering intuition makes me an ideal fit for building your GenAI-powered Concierge and Tour Guide robots:

items: **Engineering Rigor & Deployment:** Unlike a pure researcher, I have 3+ years of experience in production software environments. I understand the full lifecycle of deployment (CI/CD, Docker) and maintaining health in complex codebases—skills I currently apply using **Laravel** and **Nuxt**.

**Conversational Logic:** I have practical experience engineering conversational flows. At 9LOOP, I refactored and maintained complex **Telegram bots**, migrating them to TypeScript and drastically reducing bugs. I understand that a robot's 'brain' is only as good as the logic structures that guide it.

**The Robotics Context:** Because of my background, I understand the constraints of physical hardware and real-time processing. I am comfortable bridging the gap between abstract LLM responses and the concrete actions a robot must perform.

content: I am eager to bring my 'software stewardship' mindset to your AI team, helping you build systems that are not just intelligent, but also maintainable and reliable.

I didn't build this to be flashy. I built it because I believe engineering time is valuable. This habit of creating reliable, reusable systems to solve foundational problems is central to how I work.
